secondary_causes: Couldn't articulate who would pay and why
Spent months building before getting one paying customer

stage_1_hypothesis_building.objective: Build a testable hypothesis, not a business plan

icp_profile.example: Not 'small businesses' → 'Solo HVAC contractors with $500K-2M revenue'
icp_profile.pain_points: What specific recurring problem costs them time/money?
icp_profile.current_solution: What are they using now? (spreadsheet, manual, expensive tool)
icp_profile.budget_signals: What do they currently spend on related problems?
icp_profile.access: Where can you find 10 of these people?

value_proposition.good_example: Help solo HVAC contractors schedule appointments 24/7 without missing calls

hypothesis_template.example: Solo dentists lose $8K/month because no-shows waste 40-minute slots. An AI reminder system that reduces no-shows 40% in 30 days. Dentists currently pay $800/mo for office staff to manually call reminders.

tools_to_use: Reddit search: '[industry] + I wish there was'
G2 reviews: 2-3 star reviews of competitors
Upwork: What are people paying freelancers to do?
LinkedIn: Search for your ICP, see what they post about
Industry forums: Scan for recurring complaints
stage_1_hypothesis_building.validation_checkpoint: Can you name 10 specific people who have this problem?

stage_2_customer_discovery.objective: Validate the problem (not the solution) with 10-25 interviews

why_25_not_50.insight: With a hypothesis from Stage 1, you need fewer interviews
why_25_not_50.data: 60% of B2B marketers captured ICP elements after 20 interviews with hypothesis

tier_1_warm: Twitter/X DMs: 'Researching X problem, mind 10 minutes?'
tier_2_cold: Cold email (interview, not sales): 10-20% response rate
tier_3_communities: Reddit: Comment in target industry subs, ask for interviews
Facebook groups: Value-first posts, then interview requests
Industry conferences: Virtual or in-person networking

interview_script.introduction: Hi [Name], I'm researching [problem area] and would love to understand your workflow. Not selling anything, just learning. 15-20 minutes?
questions: What's annoying or frustrating about your current approach?
What have you tried to fix it? What happened?
What does it cost you (time or money) when [problem] happens?
Have you looked for tools to solve this? What did you find?
If there was a solution, what would you be willing to pay?
What would make you switch next week vs. in 6 months?
what_NOT_to_ask: Would you use this? (They'll say yes to be nice)
Do you like my idea? (Opinion, not commitment)
Describing your solution upfront (You're biasing them)

what_to_listen_for.pain_urgency: Is this a 'nice to have' or 'pulling my hair out'?
what_to_listen_for.current_spend: Are they paying for workarounds now?
what_to_listen_for.decision_authority: Can they buy, or do they need 5 approvals?
what_to_listen_for.frequency: Is this daily, weekly, or once-a-year?
what_to_listen_for.exact_words: Note their language—use it in your copy

stage_2_customer_discovery.validation_checkpoint: After 10-15 interviews, can you answer: Who has the most urgent pain? What exact words do they use? What do they pay today?

stage_3_landing_page_test.objective: Quantify demand with a simple landing page + email capture

page_structure.headline: Use the exact problem language from interviews
page_structure.example: AI appointment reminders reduce no-shows 40% in 30 days
page_structure.social_proof: If you have it (testimonials, logos, case studies)
page_structure.cta: Sign up for early access' or 'Join waitlist'
page_structure.email_capture: Mailchimp, ConvertKit, or simple Google Form

budget_0: Post in relevant Reddit subs (value-first, not spam)
Share in Slack/Discord communities you're in
Ask interview participants to check it out
budget_100_500: Twitter promoted posts to niche audience
traffic_strategy.organic_seo: Blog post on 'How to solve [problem]' linking to landing page

success_metrics.excellent: 50+ email signups in 7 days, 3+ 'when can I pay?' messages
success_metrics.good: 25-50 signups, clear interest signals in comments
success_metrics.weak: 10-25 signups, mostly curious but no urgency

stage_3_landing_page_test.validation_checkpoint: Is signup rate >5% of visitors? Are people asking about pricing/launch date?

stage_4_pre_sell_or_concierge_mvp.objective: Get money BEFORE building the full product
stage_4_pre_sell_or_concierge_mvp.why_this_matters: People lie about what they'll pay. Money is the only true signal.

concierge_mvp_approach.concept: Do the work manually behind the scenes, deliver results

example_dental_reminders.offer: $79/month, I'll send appointment reminders to your patients
example_dental_reminders.behind_scenes: You manually text/call using a script and tracking sheet
example_dental_reminders.deliver: Weekly report: '24 reminders sent, 21 confirmed, 3 no-shows prevented'
example_dental_reminders.result: If 4+ stick for 60 days, build automation

example_hvac_booking.behind_scenes: You answer calls, book in their calendar manually
example_hvac_booking.result: Validate volume, pain, and willingness to pay before AI build

pre_sell_approach.offer: 'Lifetime access for $99' or '50% off first year'
pre_sell_approach.expectation_setting: 'Launches in 4-6 weeks, pay now to lock in price'
pre_sell_approach.refund_policy: 100% refund if not happy at launch

stage_4_pre_sell_or_concierge_mvp.validation_checkpoint: Did 5+ people pay real money? If yes, build. If no, revisit positioning or niche.

stage_5_build_and_iterate_mvp.objective: Build only the core feature that solves the core pain

mvp_scope.must_have: One core feature that solves the main pain
mvp_scope.example: Appointment reminder system → Just send SMS reminders
mvp_scope.nice_to_have: Leave for v2 (analytics, integrations, mobile app)
mvp_scope.rule: Can you deliver value in <5 minutes of user onboarding?

launch_to_waitlist.first_10_users: From your waitlist, give personal onboarding
launch_to_waitlist.track: Daily usage, feature requests, churn signals

stage_5_build_and_iterate_mvp.validation_checkpoint: Are 30-50% of users active weekly? Are they asking for more features (good sign)?

why_boring_wins.insight: Tech-savvy markets are saturated. Boring industries are under-served.
why_boring_wins.advantage: Low competition, high pain, budget exists, long retention

top_7_niches_2026.competition: Low - most use Excel or paper

top_7_niches_2026.pain: Manual report writing takes 3-4 hours post-inspection
top_7_niches_2026.tool_idea: Tap-to-report mobile app with instant PDF
top_7_niches_2026.competition: Existing tools are clunky and expensive
Medium - but most require complex integrations

top_7_niches_2026.pain: Manual inventory tracking = 30% waste on perishables

icp_research.definition: Ideal Customer Profile = specific person who has urgent pain + budget + decision authority
good_icp_examples: Solo HVAC contractors in Texas with $500K-2M revenue, 2-5 service trucks
Boutique dental practices with 3+ dentists, office manager handling scheduling
Non-profit program directors managing 3+ federal grants

step_1_demographics.geography: Does location matter for your solution?

step_2_psychographics.goals: What are they trying to achieve?
step_2_psychographics.challenges: What blocks them from reaching goals?
step_2_psychographics.tech_savvy: Do they use Slack or email?

step_3_behavioral.buying_patterns: Monthly SaaS? One-time purchase? Annual contracts?
step_3_behavioral.budget_authority: Can they swipe card or need approval?

validation_questions: Can I name 10 specific people who fit this profile?
Do they have budget for this category ($X/month is normal)?
Can I reach 100 of them in the next 30 days?
Do they have urgent, recurring pain (not nice-to-have)?
Can they buy without 5 levels of approval?

yellow_flags: High interest but low willingness to pay
Feature requests all over the map (unclear core pain)

option_a_single_breakout.requirements: Viral growth, strong network effects, or enterprise upsell

option_b_portfolio_approach.requirements: Repeatable playbook, VA support, clear niches

option_c_hybrid_services.strategy: Micro-SaaS as lead gen for high-ticket services

revenue_model.reality_check: Micro-SaaS alone to $100K/month is rare. Use as ONE revenue stream.

key_insights: 42% of startups fail due to 'no market need' - validate before building
Boring industries: highest pain + budget, lowest competition
Validation timeline: 2-4 weeks max (hypothesis → interviews → landing page → pre-sell)
Money is the only true validation signal - get pre-sales or concierge clients
MVP scope: ONE core feature that solves core pain, ship in weeks not months
Top micro-SaaS: $5K-50K MRR, 70-90% margins, solo/small team
Go signals: 10+ signups in 48h, 5+ pre-sales, 40%+ retention, low CAC
Red flags: <5 signups per 500 visitors, no willingness to pay, zero retention
$100K/month via micro-SaaS requires portfolio approach or services hybrid
immediate_action_steps: 1. Define specific ICP (role + industry + size + pain)
3. Find 10 people who match ICP profile (can you name them?)
4. Conduct 10-15 customer discovery interviews (validate problem, not solution)
5. Build landing page with problem language from interviews
7. If signups > 25, offer concierge MVP or pre-sell
8. Get 5+ paying customers BEFORE building full product
9. Build MVP with ONE core feature using no-code tools
10. Track retention (40%+ day 7, 20%+ day 30) and iterate
